result.execSummary:
The defendant David D Sousek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: 15 years to register as a sex offender.   Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.    Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  NOT Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & NOT eligible for Substance Abuse programs REgister and maintain active registry with SORP. Enter, Participate in, and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment recommendations as directed by the agent, may not withdrawal from any programming without agent and treatment provider approval.  No contact with minors under the age of 18 without a DOC approved chaperone and prior approval of the DOC. No computer or internet access without prior agent approvel, including cell phone with camera/ionternet capability without prior agent approval and complaiance with SORP on internet identifiers.  No engaging on social media without prior agent approval and compliance with SORP on internet identifiers.  No possession of sexually explicit materials.  Obtain/maintain full time employment.  No firearms-weapons. Pay costs and supervision fees as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney James Richard Lex.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Report was reviewed by the parties.  No factual errors were found in the report.  Court addresses the parties.

Court orders:
 5 years Initial conf 5 years Extended supervision
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
conditions set forth in the PSI on pages 17 & 18
Sex Registry for 15 years
Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
DOC to remove $250 DNA cost upon proof of previous payment.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
NOT Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & NOT eligible for Substance Abuse programs
362 days sentence credit

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Not to own or possess any firearms.  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
Statement as to negotiated plea

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense wishes to proceed to sentencing today.  State would like to have input from Probation for the length of extended supervision.  Court reviews.  Court will be ordering a PSI but if the defense attorney can get the information necessary to the court sooner the PSI  will be cancelled.  Deft enters a plea of no contest   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.  Advised of the Sex offender registry.

Court to order a PSI.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense to suppress statements.  Case called at 11:06 am.  Victim rights have complied with.  Eric Soberg  duly sworn and testifies.  Id'd deft.  Court denies the motion (defense can bring back if needed after reviewing the interview video).  Defense addresses the court for a Bond Modification.  Arguements heard.  Court rules to deny the motion to modify bond.  The option to use property and cash is still available
to modify the bond.  Arguements heard from parties regarding the bond.  Court feels that the $25000 cash that was set is correct.  Court denies the modify

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr Galli's report has been reviewed by both parties.  Deft accepts the report from Dr Galli.  Court advises the deft of his rights to Dr Galli's report.  FVI.  Deft is competent to proceed.  Opinion of the doctor is accepted by the deft.  Court finds that the deft is competent to proceed.  Clerk is to seal the report of Dr Galli.

  Motion hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
by Department of Health Services - signed by the courts.

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex (Attorney Nocco appearing on behalf of Lex).  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for bond modification.  Arguements heard.  State objects to any type of modification to the bond.  The court denies the bond modification.  The cash amount needed is $25,000.  No change to the bond at this time.

Not to leave Lincoln, Marathon, Portage, Wood or Taylor Counties. No contact w/any females under the age of 18 years of age unless deft's children.  To be at home from 9:00 pm un 6:00 am.  No use of computer or any other electronic device.
filed - reading waived.  ARGN: Not guilty pleas entered.

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Soberg  duly sworn and testifies.

Defense requests to be heard regarding the bond amount.  Court rules to not modify the amount of the bond to $25,000 at this time w/special conditions.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:35 am.

If the $25,000 cash is posted need to let the DA office know so they can request a speedy trial demand.  If defense decides to use property as part of the bond the would need to set a hearing to review the necessary paperwork.

Defendant David D Sousek in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Time limits for the preliminary hearing   Bond set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
